gw.wsi.pl

Class SystemToolsAPI

  • gw.wsi.pl.SystemToolsAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    public class SystemToolsAPI
implements _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

        IntrinsicType

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SystemToolsAPI()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelUpdateStats()
      Cancel the update stats process if running. Please use getUpdateStatsState() to check on the state of the run.
      SessionData[] getActiveSessionData()
      Returns all server session information. The session information is returned as an array of SessionData objects, each of which contains the user's name, ID, and session ID for a session that's currently open.
      WorkItemSetState getDBCCState()
      Returns the state of the consistency checks process. Only one set of consistency checks can be running at any given moment.
      SystemRunlevel getHighestRunlevel()
      Gets the highest run level of the cluster. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
      String[] getLoggingCategories()
      Get a list of all of the logger categories available in the system. These can be used directly in logging.properties.
      String[] getPerfReportsInfo(int numDownloads)
      Retrieve the information about the latest N Oracle AWR downloads.
      DatabaseSnapshotInfo[] getRecentAWRSnapshotInfo(int numSnapshots)
      Retrieve the latest N Oracle AWR snapshots.
      SystemRunlevel getRunlevel()
      Gets the run level of the server. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
      WorkItemSetState getUpdateStatsState()
      Returns the state of the update stats process. Only one update stats process can be running at any given moment.
      ServerVersion getVersion()
      Get the version of the server, including application version and schema version. The application version is in the format: [major].[minor].[build]. The scheme version is in the format: [base].[vertical].
      boolean recalculateFileChecksums()
      Recalculates the file checksums used for clustered configuration verification. Returns true if checksums were recalcuted and false if clustering or configuration verification were disabled.
      void reloadLoggingConfig()
      Causes a reload of the logging.properties.
      byte[] reportDatabaseCatalogStatistics()
      Creates a report of the state of the database catalog statistics for all tables.
      byte[] reportPartialDatabaseCatalogStatistics(String[] tables, String[] stagingTables, String[] typelistTables)
      Creates a report of the state of the database catalog statistics for all tables.
      void setRunlevel(SystemRunlevel runLevel)
      Sets the run level of this specific server. If the server is currently undergoing a runlevel change, this method will block until that level change has completed.

      The valid run levels that the server can be set to through this method are SystemRunlevel.GW_DB_MAINTENANCE, SystemRunlevel.GW_MAINTENANCE, and SystemRunlevel.GW_MULTIUSER. See the definitions of those constants for more information.
      ProcessID submitAwrReportBatchJob(int beginSnapshot, int endSnapshot, boolean probeVDollarTables)
      Submit the Oracle AWR Performance Report batch job with three parameters.
      ProcessID submitAwrReportBatchJobAllOpts(int beginSnapshot, int endSnapshot, boolean probeVDollarTables, boolean capturePeakedBindVariables, boolean searchForQueriesWithMultiplePlans, boolean searchForQueriesOnlyInFirstSnapshot, boolean searchForQueriesOnlyInLastSnapshot, boolean includeMetadataForInstrumentationTables, boolean useExperimentalRawDataOutput, boolean includeDatabaseStatistics, boolean probeSQLMonitor, boolean capturePeakedBindVariablesFromAWR, boolean generateCallsToASHScripts)
      Submit the Oracle AWR Performance Report batch job with all possible parameters.
      ProcessID submitDBCCBatchJob(String[] tablesToCheck, String[] consistencyCheckTypesToCheck)
      Submit the consistency checks batch job on the underlying physical database.
      ProcessID submitDmvReportBatchJob(boolean includeDatabaseStatistics)
      Submit the SQL Server DMV Performance Report batch job.
      void submitUpdateStats(String description, boolean incremental)
      Run the update stats process on the underlying physical database. Please use isUpdateStatsRunning() to check on the state of the run.
      void updateLoggingLevel(String logger, SystemOutLogger.LoggingLevel level)
      Dynamically updates the logging level of the given logger.
      String[] verifyDatabaseSchema()
      Verify that the data mode matches the physical database

    • Constructor Detail

      • SystemToolsAPI

        SystemToolsAPI()

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        ServerVersion getVersion()
        Get the version of the server, including application version and schema version. The application version is in the format: [major].[minor].[build]. The scheme version is in the format: [base].[vertical].
        Returns:
        Version of the server, including application version and schema version.

      • submitDBCCBatchJob

        ProcessID submitDBCCBatchJob(String[] tablesToCheck,
                           String[] consistencyCheckTypesToCheck)
        Submit the consistency checks batch job on the underlying physical database.
        Parameters:
        tablesToCheck - null - check all tables, else array of tables names to check
        consistencyCheckTypesToCheck - null - check all types, else array of types to check Must be valid ConsistencyCheckTypes.
        Returns:
        ProcessID Describes results of consistency checks

      • getDBCCState

        WorkItemSetState getDBCCState()
        Returns the state of the consistency checks process. Only one set of consistency checks can be running at any given moment.
        Returns:
        the state of the consistency checks process

      • submitUpdateStats

        void submitUpdateStats(String description,
                     boolean incremental)
        Run the update stats process on the underlying physical database. Please use isUpdateStatsRunning() to check on the state of the run.
        Parameters:
        description - null - Description of the job
        incremental - true: the process should perform an incremental update; false: the process should perform a full upgrade

      • cancelUpdateStats

        void cancelUpdateStats()
        Cancel the update stats process if running. Please use getUpdateStatsState() to check on the state of the run.

      • getUpdateStatsState

        WorkItemSetState getUpdateStatsState()
        Returns the state of the update stats process. Only one update stats process can be running at any given moment.
        Returns:
        the state of the update stats process

      • submitDmvReportBatchJob

        ProcessID submitDmvReportBatchJob(boolean includeDatabaseStatistics)
        Submit the SQL Server DMV Performance Report batch job.
        Parameters:
        includeDatabaseStatistics - The default is true.
        Returns:
        ProcessID pid of batch job

      • getRecentAWRSnapshotInfo

        DatabaseSnapshotInfo[] getRecentAWRSnapshotInfo(int numSnapshots)
        Retrieve the latest N Oracle AWR snapshots.
        Parameters:
        numSnapshots - Number of snapshots to retrieve.
        Returns:
        String[] Requested AWR snapshot information

      • submitAwrReportBatchJob

        ProcessID submitAwrReportBatchJob(int beginSnapshot,
                                int endSnapshot,
                                boolean probeVDollarTables)
        Submit the Oracle AWR Performance Report batch job with three parameters.
        Parameters:
        beginSnapshot - ID of the beginning snapshot
        endSnapshot - ID of the ending snapshot
        probeVDollarTables - True or false
        Returns:
        ProcessID pid of batch job

      • submitAwrReportBatchJobAllOpts

        ProcessID submitAwrReportBatchJobAllOpts(int beginSnapshot,
                                       int endSnapshot,
                                       boolean probeVDollarTables,
                                       boolean capturePeakedBindVariables,
                                       boolean searchForQueriesWithMultiplePlans,
                                       boolean searchForQueriesOnlyInFirstSnapshot,
                                       boolean searchForQueriesOnlyInLastSnapshot,
                                       boolean includeMetadataForInstrumentationTables,
                                       boolean useExperimentalRawDataOutput,
                                       boolean includeDatabaseStatistics,
                                       boolean probeSQLMonitor,
                                       boolean capturePeakedBindVariablesFromAWR,
                                       boolean generateCallsToASHScripts)
        Submit the Oracle AWR Performance Report batch job with all possible parameters.
        Parameters:
        beginSnapshot -
        endSnapshot -
        probeVDollarTables - Whether to probe the V$Dollar tables
        capturePeakedBindVariables - Whether to capturePeakedBindVariables
        searchForQueriesWithMultiplePlans - Whether to search for queries with mulitiple plans
        searchForQueriesOnlyInFirstSnapshot - Whether to search for queries only in first snapshot
        searchForQueriesOnlyInLastSnapshot - Whether to search for queries only in last snapshot
        includeMetadataForInstrumentationTables - Whether to include metadata for instrumentation tables
        useExperimentalRawDataOutput - Whether to use experimental raw data output
        includeDatabaseStatistics - Whether to include database statistics
        probeSQLMonitor - Whether to probe SQL monitor
        capturePeakedBindVariablesFromAWR - Whether to capture peaked bind variables from AWR
        generateCallsToASHScripts - Whether to generate calls to ASH scripts
        Returns:
        Process ID of submitted batch job

      • getPerfReportsInfo

        String[] getPerfReportsInfo(int numDownloads)
        Retrieve the information about the latest N Oracle AWR downloads.
        Parameters:
        numDownloads - How many AWR downloads for which to return info. Passing 0 means to return all available.
        Returns:
        PerfDownloadDetail[] Requested AWR download information

      • reportDatabaseCatalogStatistics

        byte[] reportDatabaseCatalogStatistics()
        Creates a report of the state of the database catalog statistics for all tables.
        Returns:
        a zip file of an HTML report to view the database catalog statistics.

      • reportPartialDatabaseCatalogStatistics

        byte[] reportPartialDatabaseCatalogStatistics(String[] tables,
                                            String[] stagingTables,
                                            String[] typelistTables)
        Creates a report of the state of the database catalog statistics for all tables.
        Parameters:
        tables - null - report on all tables, else array of tables names to on which to report
        stagingTables - null - report on all staging tables, else array of staging tables names to on which to report
        typelistTables - null - report on all typelist tables, else array of typelist tables names to on which to report
        Returns:
        a zip file of an HTML report to view the database catalog statistics on the selected tables.

      • verifyDatabaseSchema

        String[] verifyDatabaseSchema()
        Verify that the data mode matches the physical database
        Returns:
        String[] Any differences between the data model and the physical database.

      • setRunlevel

        void setRunlevel(SystemRunlevel runLevel)
        Sets the run level of this specific server. If the server is currently undergoing a runlevel change, this method will block until that level change has completed.

        The valid run levels that the server can be set to through this method are SystemRunlevel.GW_DB_MAINTENANCE, SystemRunlevel.GW_MAINTENANCE, and SystemRunlevel.GW_MULTIUSER. See the definitions of those constants for more information.

        Parameters:
        runLevel - The level at which the server should run.

      • getRunlevel

        SystemRunlevel getRunlevel()
        Gets the run level of the server. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
        Returns:
        An int containing the runlevel

      • getHighestRunlevel

        SystemRunlevel getHighestRunlevel()
        Gets the highest run level of the cluster. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
        Returns:
        An int containing the highest runlevel of the cluster.

      • getActiveSessionData

        SessionData[] getActiveSessionData()
        Returns all server session information. The session information is returned as an array of SessionData objects, each of which contains the user's name, ID, and session ID for a session that's currently open.
        Returns:
        all server session information.

      • updateLoggingLevel

        void updateLoggingLevel(String logger,
                      SystemOutLogger.LoggingLevel level)
        Dynamically updates the logging level of the given logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - The name of the logger to be updated - this should be a qualified class or package
        level - One of 5 possible logging levels: INFO, DEBUG, WARN, ERROR, TRACE

      • reloadLoggingConfig

        void reloadLoggingConfig()
        Causes a reload of the logging.properties.

      • recalculateFileChecksums

        boolean recalculateFileChecksums()
        Recalculates the file checksums used for clustered configuration verification. Returns true if checksums were recalcuted and false if clustering or configuration verification were disabled.
        Returns:
        true if checksums were recalcuted and false if clustering or configuration verification were disabled.

      • getLoggingCategories

        String[] getLoggingCategories()
        Get a list of all of the logger categories available in the system. These can be used directly in logging.properties.
        Returns:
        An array of Strings containing all logger categories in the system
